availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, stonemason. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann Ward Glore in Franklin County, Kentucky, on November 15, 1852. Father of John T. Glore, Susan Mary Glore, Lewis H. Glore, Sarah F. Glore, and Charles S. Glore. Stonemason in Frankfort, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 400.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 155B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994034, Franklin County Marriages, p. 53.
"L. W. Glore (1830-1882)," Find A Grave, Memorial 135753802, accessed January 26, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135753802.
